author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Popular Front of India has urged the Puducherry government to enhance reservation for Muslims from 2 per cent to 4 per cent and ensure reservation in Group B posts.

Talking to reporters here on Thursday, Mohammed Sheik Ansari, general secretary of the Front, said the government should increase the quota to 4 per cent. The current reservation is not in proportion to the Muslim population, which was 6.1 per cent as per the 2011 census.

Though the government had announced reservation of 2 per cent for Muslims in the Union Territory in 2010, it was confined only to Group C posts and not Group B posts . Reservation should be fair and Muslims be treated on a par with other communities . A level-playing field would be welcome, he said.

Muslims, Mr. Ansari said, were far behind in various fields and the government should increase the reservation for their uplift.

The government should present a White Paper on the percentage of Muslims in government jobs. The Popular Front of India would take out a rally towards the Assembly on Friday in support of the demands, he said.
title: Govt. urged to increase quota for Muslims
